au.edu.jcu.v4l4j
Class YVUFrameGrabber

java.lang.Object
  au.edu.jcu.v4l4j.YVUFrameGrabber
All Implemented Interfaces:
FrameGrabber
public class YVUFrameGrabber
extends java.lang.Object

Objects of this class are used to retrieve YVU420-encoded frames from a VideoDevice. A YVU420 frame grabber can only be created if the associated video device can produce images in a format v4l4j knows how to encode in YVU420. The VideoDevice.supportYVUConversion() method can be used to find out whether a video device can have its images YVU420-encoded by v4l4j, ie if a YVU420 frame grabber can be instantiated. YVUFrameGrabber objects are not instantiated directly. Instead, the VideoDevice.getYVUFrameGrabber(int, int, int, int) or VideoDevice.getYVUFrameGrabber(int, int, int, int, ImageFormat) method must be called on the associated VideoDevice. Requested height and width may be adjusted to the closest supported values. The adjusted width and height can be retrieved by calling getWidth() and getHeight().
A typical YVUFrameGrabber use is as follows:

//create a new video device
VideoDevice vd = new VideoDevice("/dev/video0");

//Create an instance of FrameGrabber
FrameGrabber f = vd.getYVUFrameGrabber(320, 240, 0, 0, 80);

//Start the frame capture
f.startCapture();
while (!stop) {
   ByteBuffer b= f.getFrame(); //Get a frame
   //frame size is b.limit()
   //do something useful with b
}

//Stop the capture
f.stopCapture();

//Free capture resources and release the FrameGrabber
vd.releaseFrameGrabber();

//release VideoDevice
vd.release();

Once the frame grabber is released with VideoDevice.releaseFrameGrabber(), it can NOT be re-initialised again , and a new one must be obtained. However, when the capture is stopped with stopCapture(), it can be started again with startCapture() without having to create a new FrameGrabber.

Author:
gilles

Method Detail

getImageFormat

public ImageFormat getImageFormat()
This method returns the native image format used by this FrameGrabber. The returned format specifies the image format the capture uses, ie the one images are retrieved from the device BEFORE BGR conversion.

Returns:
the native image format used by this FrameGrabber.

                     throws NoTunerException
Description copied from interface: FrameGrabber
This method returns the Tuner associated with the input of this FrameGrabber, or throws a NoTunerException if there is none.

Specified by:

Returns:
the Tuner object associated with the chosen input.
Throws:
NoTunerException - if the selected input does not have a tuner

startCapture

public final void startCapture()
                        throws V4L4JException
Description copied from interface: FrameGrabber
This method starts the capture. After this call, frames can be retrieved with FrameGrabber.getFrame().

Specified by:
startCapture in interface FrameGrabber
Throws:
V4L4JException - if the capture cant be started

getFrame

public final java.nio.ByteBuffer getFrame()
                                   throws V4L4JException
Description copied from interface: FrameGrabber
This method retrieves one frame from the video source. The ByteBuffer limit() is set to the size of the captured frame. Note that the returned ByteBuffer is not backed by an array. This is a JNI limitation (not v4l4j).

Specified by:
getFrame in interface FrameGrabber
Returns:
a ByteBuffer containing frame data.
Throws:
V4L4JException - if there is an error capturing from the source.

This method stops the capture.

stopCapture in interface FrameGrabber
